node.statement: REPAIRED QED: (Convergence of renormalized densities and candidate RN derivative â€” Assembly) This node establishes the following four results, proven in children 1.6.3.2 through 1.6.3.4: (I) On the Skorokhod coupling space (Omega, F, P) with Phi_eps -> Phi a.s. and law(Phi_eps) = mu_eps, law(Phi) = mu: exp(Psi_eps^{ren}(Phi_eps)) -> exp(Psi^{ren}(Phi)) in L^1(P), by the Vitali convergence theorem (a.s. convergence from node 1.6.3.2 + uniform integrability from node 1.6.3.4). (II) Z := E_mu[exp(Psi^{ren})] satisfies 0 < Z < infinity (node 1.6.3.3). (III) For all bounded continuous G on X: E_{mu_eps}[G exp(Psi_eps^{ren})] -> E_mu[G exp(Psi^{ren})] (Vitali applied to G * Y_eps with UI from 1.6.3.4). (IV) The probability measure rho := (exp(Psi^{ren})/Z) dmu is well-defined with E_mu[R] = 1, R > 0 mu-a.s. (node 1.6.3.3). CORRECTION: The original claim of uniform integrability of R_eps = exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps + K_eps) via L^p bounds is WITHDRAWN. For any fixed p > 1, E_{mu_eps}[R_eps^p] diverges as exp(C(p^2-1)(log 1/eps)^2) (node 1.5.4, validated). Instead, this node establishes UI of the RENORMALIZED factor exp(Psi_eps^{ren}) only (which excludes the divergent L_eps term). The full identification T_psi*mu = rho (handling the divergent L_eps tilt) is deferred to node 1.6.4. DEPENDENCIES: 1.5.1, 1.5.3, 1.5.4, 1.6.1, 1.6.2.5, 1.6.2.10.2.4, 1.6.2.10.3.
